image.altText: A young woman looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: Like so many Iranian Australians, Morteza Khandani has been desperate for any news of his family in Iran. Two days ago, he was able to confirm the worst. His niece, Negin Ghadimi, had been killed in anti-government protests.

title.children: 'Died in the hands of her father': Negin is one of thousands of Iranians killed

image.altText: Anthony Albanese speaks at a press conference.

props.synopsis: The Greens have thrown up a roadblock for Labor by declaring it will not support the government's sweeping changes to hate and gun laws without amendments, as the Coalition also backs away from the reforms.

title.children: Greens won't support Labor's sweeping hate law reform in current form

image.altText: Sussan Ley speak to the media.

props.synopsis: Federal Liberals are discovering the price of having been so brazen in their politicisation of the Bondi terror attack and many appear to have buyers' remorse.

title.children: Politicising Bondi backfires for Liberals who got what they asked for

image.altText: Man in a grey hoodie standing on a beach.

props.synopsis: Up to 500 workers are fighting to recoup pay, super and entitlements after the collapse of a large disability support provider operating in New South Wales.

title.children: Workers lose pay, super as NDIS provider collapses

image.altText: A close up of Jactina Allan speaking at a media event.

props.synopsis: Jacinta Allan vows to request a formal review of the state's disastrous bushfire season, following days of questions over issues like Country Fire Authority resourcing and the state's disaster preparedness.

title.children: Premier announces review into Victoria's disastrous bushfires

image.altText: Two cars washed to sea near the town of Wye River.

props.synopsis: People in a popular holiday region have been issued with an emergency warning after a storm cell dumped more than 100 millimetres of rain, flooding campsites.

title.children: Cars washed to sea, rain record smashed in Great Ocean Road deluge

image.altText: Four astronauts in spacesuits float inside the International Space Station, with electronics and cords in the background.

props.synopsis: A SpaceX capsule splashes down back to Earth carrying four astronauts from the International Space Station, after a medical issue prompted them to evacuate and cut their mission a month short.

title.children: Breaking: Four astronauts splash down back to Earth after medical evacuation from ISS

image.altText: twisted green, blue tinged steel amid concrete pillars, and crumbling rubble and debris. a pickup truck is partially trapped

props.synopsis: A second fatal crane collapse in two days has been linked to the same construction company, a Thai minister says.

title.children: Second fatal crane collapse tied to same Thai firm, minister says

image.altText: A composite of screenshots of three Instagram reels about Grok from women

props.synopsis: The X AI is not creating sexually explicit images of women on its own, but the software "facilitates their abuse" acting on the requests of men "eager to violate women".

title.children: Behind Grok's mass digital undressing lies an 'unsurprising' truth

image.altText: Alex De Minaur looks up

props.synopsis: In the first round, the world number six will face off against Matteo Berrettini, a former Australian Open semifinalist — a place De Minaur has never progressed to himself.

title.children: De Minaur to face former Aus Open semifinalist in brutal draw

image.altText: A dragonfly resting on a mobile phone with the Wikipedia page for dragonfly on the screen of phone

props.synopsis: Wikipedia is celebrating 25 years of the online encyclopedia and the enormous impact its had, while looking forward to its future. But some controversies from the past refuse to die.

title.children: Wikipedia is 25, but some old fights are still going

image.altText: A woman wearing a necklace and smile to camera

props.synopsis: The Adelaide Festival Corporation, which oversees Adelaide Writers' Week, has apologised to Palestinian Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah and says she will be invited to speak at its next event in 2027.

title.children: Adelaide Festival Corporation apologises to author Randa Abdel-Fattah

image.altText: A clocktower rises from a historic-looking building in a city.

props.synopsis: Adelaide City Council will consider supporting an alternative literary festival following the cancellation of the 2026 Adelaide Writers' Week.

title.children: 'Guerilla' Adelaide writers' festival could get council support

image.altText: Australian soldier training in the Philippines

props.synopsis: Experts say these agreements are clear signs of how important an ally the Philippines is becoming in the Indo-Pacific region amid jitters of US security guarantees.

title.children: Australia making defence investments on the expected frontline of a China conflict

image.altText: An older and a younger woman in front of a blank wall

props.synopsis: Public housing in Alice Springs is sitting vacant and in disrepair while residents wait up to a decade to be allocated a home.

title.children: 10-year wait for a home in Alice Springs as public housing sits vacant

image.altText: The exterior of a modern three-storey home from the backyard with a swimming pool to the left and a towering jacaranda right.

props.synopsis: It's a familiar story on design shows. Home owners launch into building projects with budgets and timelines that don't always match their lofty ambitions. Take our quiz to measure your renovation planning skills.

title.children: Quiz: Think you can price a renovation? These home owners thought so too

image.altText: Jannik Sinner applauds the crowd at a tennis match

props.synopsis: The Australian Open has smashed attendance records in what is being marketed as "Opening Week", featuring fan events and qualifying matches, but the main draw does not start until Sunday.

title.children: Complaints roll in as record crowds watch qualifiers in AO 'Opening Week'

image.altText: Caravans in a row.

props.synopsis: The luxury caravan manufacturer will be wound up, with liquidators promising to step up their investigation into allegations against Zone RV director David Biggar.

title.children: Zone RV in liquidation as police confirm fraud investigation

image.altText: Tom Silvagni, whose name was suppressed throughout his criminal proceedings, pictured in a suit outside court.

props.synopsis: Details of the 23-year-old's appeal bid have been released, with Silvagni arguing a judge erred in describing certain evidence as "incriminating conduct" during his rape trial late last year.

title.children: Tom Silvagni's rape conviction appeal grounds revealed

image.altText: Three-year-old Ineza King dies following Banya truck crash

props.synopsis: A three-year-old girl who suffered critical head injuries in a horrific multi-vehicle crash last week in regional Queensland has died in hospital, with her family remembering her as a "beautiful spirit".

title.children: Family remembers 'beautiful' three-year-old girl following horror truck crash

image.altText: A woman standing beneath a jetty.

props.synopsis: South Australian ecologist Dr Faith Coleman has resigned from two state government algal bloom panels and criticised the state government's approach.

title.children: SA ecologist resigns from algal bloom panels, citing government's 'adversarial' approach

image.altText: An Australian and UK passport lay on a bench.

props.synopsis: Your guide to new UK and Ireland passport rules for dual citizens and general entry changes beginning in February.

title.children: How the new passport rules for UK dual citizens will work

image.altText: A photo of the app Demumu, previously known as Are You Dead, on a phone.

props.synopsis: A viral Chinese app named Are You Dead aimed at people living alone has been rebranded to avoid controversy.

title.children: The sad statistic behind China's Are You Dead app

image.altText: A woman standing in her front garden glaring at the camera.

props.synopsis: Residents and small business owners in the Hunter Valley town of Cessnock say they fear the rate increase, if approved, could price people out of the area.

title.children: NSW town to ask for 'unfathomable' 40 pc rate hike

image.altText: A Palestinian woman wearing a long purple tunic, hijab, holds a toddler in her arms, in front of a mound of rubble.

props.synopsis: With little fanfare, the White House has announced "phase two" of the Gaza ceasefire has begun — at least, in terms of how it views the situation with the war-ravaged territory.

title.children: US announces second phase of Gaza ceasefire plan

image.altText: Man with grey beard and hair smiling, with foliage in the background

props.synopsis: A Sydney school teacher accused of plotting the sexual assault of two children he was allegedly "pimping out" to another man is refused bail.

title.children: Teacher accused of 'pimping out' children to be drugged, assaulted

image.altText: Jeremy and Patricia are flanked by police as they deliver a press conference with the ocean in the background

props.synopsis: Jeremy and Patricia Connor have publicly thanked those who rushed to help after the one-year anniversary of the crash.

title.children: Survivors of deadly Rottnest seaplane crash recall moments after impact

image.altText: A limestone bridge structure with two arches carved by sea

props.synopsis: Kelli Bryers wasn't sure if anyone had seen the London Bridge rock formation collapse just seconds after she and her cousin, David Darrington, had crossed it.

title.children: 'No joke, London Bridge has fallen down': Trapped on a crumbling Apostle

image.altText: Two officers stand surrounded by tear gas at nighttime.

props.synopsis: A federal law enforcement officer has shot a man in the leg in Minneapolis after being attacked with a shovel and broom handle during an arrest, US officials say.

title.children: Federal officer shoots man in leg during Minneapolis arrest

image.altText: An Asian man in a white American Football jersey and cap looks sad as he sits on a seat in a suburban house

props.synopsis: According to court documents, at least 20 workers are owed money for the work they did in late 2023 on Corrigan's Farm in south-east Melbourne, which experts say is part of a bigger problem that sees tens of millions in missing cash disappear into the black economy.

title.children: 'Heartbroken' farm workers chase $260,000 in unpaid wages

image.altText: The PM and NSW premier speaking at a press conference

props.synopsis: WA Police charge a 19-year-old man after he allegedly uses social media to send messages, threatening to kill Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and NSW Premier Chris Minns.

title.children: Teenager charged over alleged online threats to kill PM, NSW premier

image.altText: close up image of footballer antonio arena in a white AS Roma jersey

props.synopsis: In Italy, he has earned the nickname Il Baby Bomber because of his size, strength and impact on the game. But where do his international allegiances lie?

title.children: Antonio Arena has put the football world on notice, but will he play for the Socceroos?

image.altText: A large and unique looking purple and green flower

props.synopsis: A corpse flower at the Adelaide Botanic Garden is generating excitement but it is actually among five of the rare plant to bloom in the city this summer.

title.children: 'Smellanie' the corpse flower set to attract thousands to Adelaide Botanic Garden
